replacements.name: sisalto
replacements.defaultValue:
Congratulations! You have been accepted to the study place mentioned above in the autumn 2019 joint application to higher education.

This letter also includes information about the situation of your other study options. After you have been accepted to the study place, your possible lower preferences have been cancelled automatically. If you have been placed on a waiting list for any of your higher preference study options, you can still be accepted to one of them if a place becomes available. You can find more information on the admission criteria of each study programme you have applied to from Studyinfo.fi and the higher education institution in question.

Confirming a study place

You have to confirm the study place mentioned above by 9th December 2019 at 3 pm (EET) or you will lose the study place. Confirm the study place preferably electronically with the link that has been sent to your email or in the My Studyinfo -service. You can find instructions on page 3 as well as from Studyinfo.fi: Higher education > Applying > Confirming a study place in higher education.

In addition to confirming the study place, you need to register as a student at the higher education institution by the deadline. If you do not register by the deadline you will lose your right to study. If you confirm the study place in the My Studyinfo -service, you can continue directly to the electronic registration service. Each higher education institution has instructions on how to register and information on starting studies on their own website: see the link "Instructions for new students" at the bottom of the page.

Conditional acceptance

According to the study programme's admission criteria, your admission result may be conditional. Conditional acceptance is based on a degree with a certificate that cannot yet be obtained or on information you have provided and which will be checked later (for example, in admission to universities of applied sciences, general upper secondary school certificates or vocational upper secondary school certificates and higher education degree certificates as well as possible employment certificates). A conditional acceptance will be cancelled, if the higher education institution has not received copies of the required document(s) by the deadline. Please check the deadline from the admission criteria. A conditional acceptance may also be cancelled, if it has been made based on unconfirmed, predicted grades should the final grades be lower. If the information you have provided proves incorrect, your study place may be cancelled.

Appeals

If you believe there has been a mistake in the student selection and the admission criteria have not been applied correctly, you can make a written request for rectification within 14 days after the student selection results have been published, that is by 13th December 2019 at the latest before the closing time of the higher education institution. Always check the admission criteria of the study programme and the instructions regarding rectifications first. If necessary, you can then contact the higher education institution in question. You can make a written, individualized request for rectification by the deadline mentioned above. More detailed information about making a request for rectification and contact information can be found on the website and in the application material of the higher education institution in question. The higher education institution will not process a request for rectification if it concerns a study option that you have placed lower on your application than the one you have been accepted to.

The request for rectification must be addressed to a recipient defined by the higher education institution and must be submitted to the address stated in the admission criteria by the deadline mentioned above.

replacements.name: sis2
replacements.defaultValue:
The admission result can be accepted, accepted (conditional), on the waiting list, rejected or cancelled. The admission result will state "cancelled", if you have been accepted to a higher preference. The admission result will also be cancelled if all the study places and reserve places for that study option have been filled and your score has not been sufficient for you to be admitted or placed on the waiting list. The higher education institutions can determine the number of reserve places for each study programme, and not all study programmes have reserve places. If your admission result states "rejected", you cannot be accepted to that study programme because you have not met the minimum of the admission requirements necessary to be admitted. In that case, you will see the reason for why you have not been admitted under the name of the study programme.

Selection method - Your score / The lowest accepted score:
Here you can see your own score in each of the study options’ selection methods and the lowest score that an applicant has been accepted with by the selection method in question. If the study programme uses a quota for first-time applicants, the lowest score for non-first-time applicants may be higher than the lowest score shown in the table with the results. The score may consist of several different parts. You can find information on how points are given from the study programme’s admission criteria. The total score may not always be the only deciding factor for student selections. For example, a failed language test or one failed section of the entrance examination may prevent the selection despite the total score. You can see the score only if it is possible to count the points for you according to this selection method. The column is empty if there are no points given in the selection method or if it is not possible to count your points.

Your reserve place status - Here you can see your reserve place status if you have been placed on a waiting list. It is possible that you have been placed on a waiting list in several queues in the same study programme. The selection methods are applied according to the higher education institution’s admission criteria. You can find more detailed information on the selection methods from the admission criteria of the study programme in question.

Accepted (conditional) - This admission result means that the admission decision is conditional and will be confirmed only after you have proven to the higher education institution that the condition has been met. Universities of applied sciences also use the term "Accepted" for conditional acceptance.

If you need help with interpreting the selection results or if you need more detailed information about the basis for rejection, you can contact the admission services of the higher education institution in question.

replacements.name: sis3
replacements.defaultValue:
Confirming the study place and registration for studies

Remember to confirm the study place and register as a student by the date given or you will lose the study place. (Universities Act 38 § and 43 § / Polytechnics Act 28c § 32 §). Confirm the study place preferably electronically with the link that has been sent to your email or in the My Studyinfo -service. After you have confirmed the study place, you can register as a student in the higher education institution either electronically (the link to the registration will open after you have confirmed the study place in the My Studyinfo -service) or in the way indicated by the higher education institution.

Confirming the study place

You must confirm the study place by 9th December 2019 at 3 pm (EET). You can only confirm the study place once and you cannot change the confirmation you have made afterwards. You can only confirm one higher education study place starting in the same academic term (1st January 2020 to 31 July 2020). The one place per term provision applies to both joint application and separate applications in higher education (transfer student applications are not included in the provision).

You can confirm the study place electronically with the link that has been sent to your email. If you have Finnish online banking credentials, a mobile certificate or a smart ID card and a reader, you can confirm the place by logging in to the My Studyinfo -service from the link on top of the Studyinfo.fi front page. The My Studyinfo -service has instructions on how to confirm the study place electronically.

If you cannot confirm the study place electronically, confirm the study place by using the form on the next page. Make sure the form arrives to the address stated on the bottom of the page by 9th December 2019 at 3 pm (EET). If the form arrives to the higher education institution late, you will lose the study place.

When you confirm the study place, you will not be considered a first-time applicant in future applications. More information: Studyinfo.fi > Higher education > Applying > Quota for first-time applicants. After you have confirmed the study place, you must also register as an attending or a non-attending student for the spring term 2020 by the date given by the higher education institution or you will lose your right to study.

Registering as a student

You can register as a student in the higher education institution either electronically through the national registration service when you confirm the study place or in another way indicated by the higher education institution.

If you confirm the study place but remain on the waiting list for a study place higher on your preference list, you can only register as an attending or a non-attending student after your study place has been confirmed by the higher education institution. More detailed instructions on how to register can be found from the registration service and the higher education institution you have applied to (see the link "Instructions for new students" at the bottom of the page).

NB! If you are required to pay tuition fees, you cannot register for the academic year before you have completed your payment. You can check this from the higher education institution.

You can register as non-attending for the first academic year only for statutory reasons, that is military or civilian service, maternity leave, paternity leave or parental leave or due to illness or disability. Not completing the registration will lead to forfeiting the right to study (Universities Act § 43 / Polytechnics Act § 32).

replacements.name: subject
replacements.defaultValue: Notification of the student selection results in joint application to higher education

replacements.name: kirjeotsikko
replacements.defaultValue: Notification of the student selection results in joint application to higher education autumn 2019

replacements.name: vastaanotto_1
replacements.defaultValue:
You have been accepted to the study place mentioned above in the autumn 2019 joint application to higher education.

If you are not using the email link or the My Studyinfo -service, fill and sign this notification and deliver it to the address stated below by 9th December 2019 at 3 pm (EET). If you have confirmed the place electronically, you do not have to send the notification of confirmation of a study place by post.

Concerning the study place mentioned above, I bindingly confirm the following (tick one box):

replacements.name: vastaanotto_vaihtoehto_1
replacements.defaultValue: I confirm the study place. I have not confirmed a study place leading to a higher education degree beginning in spring term 2020 prior to this notification. After this confirmation I cannot confirm another higher education study place beginning in spring term 2020.

replacements.name: vastaanotto_vaihtoehto_2
replacements.defaultValue: I confirm the study place, but remain on the waiting list for a study place higher on my preference list. If I am accepted to my higher preference by 17th December 2019 at 3 pm (EET), the study place offered here will be cancelled automatically. If I am not accepted to my higher preference by 17 December 2019 at 3 pm (EET), the confirmation of the study place mentioned in this form will remain valid.

replacements.name: vastaanotto_vaihtoehto_3
replacements.defaultValue: I will not confirm the study place.

replacements.name: sivu_2_otsikko
replacements.defaultValue: Your current situation in joint application to higher education autumn 2019

Congratulations! You have been accepted to the study place mentioned above in the autumn 2019 joint application to higher education.

This letter also includes information about the situation of your other study options. After you have been accepted to the study place, your possible lower preferences have been cancelled automatically. If you have been placed on a waiting list for any of your higher preference study options, you can still be accepted to one of them if a place becomes available. You can find more information on the admission criteria of each study programme you have applied to from Studyinfo.fi and the higher education institution in question.

Confirming a study place

You have to confirm the study place mentioned above by 9th December 2019 at 3 pm (EET) or you will lose the study place. Confirm the study place preferably electronically with the link that has been sent to your email or in the My Studyinfo -service. You can find instructions on chapter "Confirming the study place" as well as from Studyinfo.fi: Higher education > Applying > Confirming a study place in higher education.

In addition to confirming the study place, you need to register as a student at the higher education institution by the deadline. If you do not register by the deadline you will lose your right to study. If you confirm the study place in the My Studyinfo -service, you can continue directly to the electronic registration service. Each higher education institution has instructions on how to register and information on starting studies on their own website: see the link on chapter "Instructions for new students".

Conditional acceptance

According to the study programme's admission criteria, your admission result may be conditional. Conditional acceptance is based on a degree with a certificate that cannot yet be obtained or on information you have provided and which will be checked later (for example, in admission to universities of applied sciences, general upper secondary school certificates or vocational upper secondary school certificates and higher education degree certificates as well as possible employment certificates). A conditional acceptance will be cancelled, if the higher education institution has not received copies of the required document(s) by the deadline. Please check the deadline from the admission criteria. A conditional acceptance may also be cancelled, if it has been made based on unconfirmed, predicted grades should the final grades be lower. If the information you have provided proves incorrect, your study place may be cancelled.

Appeals

If you believe there has been a mistake in the student selection and the admission criteria have not been applied correctly, you can make a written request for rectification within 14 days after the student selection results have been published, that is by 13th December 2019 at the latest before the closing time of the higher education institution. Always check the admission criteria of the study programme and the instructions regarding rectifications first. If necessary, you can then contact the higher education institution in question. You can make a written, individualized request for rectification by the deadline mentioned above. More detailed information about making a request for rectification and contact information can be found on the website and in the application material of the higher education institution in question. The higher education institution will not process a request for rectification if it concerns a study option that you have placed lower on your application than the one you have been accepted to.

The request for rectification must be addressed to a recipient defined by the higher education institution and must be submitted to the address stated in the admission criteria by the deadline mentioned above.

Welcome to study!

$sivu_2_otsikko

The admission result
The admission result can be accepted, accepted (conditional), on the waiting list, rejected or cancelled. The admission result will state "cancelled", if you have been accepted to a higher preference. The admission result will also be cancelled if all the study places and reserve places for that study option have been filled and your score has not been sufficient for you to be admitted or placed on the waiting list. The higher education institutions can determine the number of reserve places for each study programme, and not all study programmes have reserve places. If your admission result states "rejected", you cannot be accepted to that study programme because you have not met the minimum of the admission requirements necessary to be admitted. In that case, you will see the reason for why you have not been admitted under the name of the study programme.
Selection method - Your score / The lowest accepted score
Here you can see your own score in each of the study options’ selection methods and the lowest score that an applicant has been accepted with by the selection method in question. If the study programme uses a quota for first-time applicants, the lowest score for non-first-time applicants may be higher than the lowest score shown in the table with the results. The score may consist of several different parts. You can find information on how points are given from the study programme’s admission criteria. The total score may not always be the only deciding factor for student selections. For example, a failed language test or one failed section of the entrance examination may prevent the selection despite the total score. You can see the score only if it is possible to count the points for you according to this selection method. The column is empty if there are no points given in the selection method or if it is not possible to count your points.
Your reserve place status
Here you can see your reserve place status if you have been placed on a waiting list. It is possible that you have been placed on a waiting list in several queues in the same study programme. The selection methods are applied according to the higher education institution’s admission criteria. You can find more detailed information on the selection methods from the admission criteria of the study programme in question.
Accepted (conditional)
This admission result means that the admission decision is conditional and will be confirmed only after you have proven to the higher education institution that the condition has been met. Universities of applied sciences also use the term "Accepted" for conditional acceptance.

If you need help with interpreting the selection results or if you need more detailed information about the basis for rejection, you can contact the admission services of the higher education institution in question.

Confirming the study place and registration for studies

Remember to confirm the study place and register as a student by the date given or you will lose the study place. (Universities Act 38 § and 43 § / Polytechnics Act 28c § 32 §). Confirm the study place preferably electronically with the link that has been sent to your email or in the My Studyinfo -service. After you have confirmed the study place, you can register as a student in the higher education institution either electronically (the link to the registration will open after you have confirmed the study place in the My Studyinfo -service) or in the way indicated by the higher education institution.

Confirming the study place

You must confirm the study place by 9th December 2019 at 3 pm (EET). You can only confirm the study place once and you cannot change the confirmation you have made afterwards. You can only confirm one higher education study place starting in the same academic term (1st January to 31th July 2020). The one place per term provision applies to both joint application and separate applications in higher education (transfer student applications are not included in the provision).

You can confirm the study place electronically with the link that has been sent to your email. If you have Finnish online banking credentials, a mobile certificate or a smart ID card and a reader, you can confirm the place by logging in to the My Studyinfo -service from the link on top of the Studyinfo.fi front page. The My Studyinfo -service has instructions on how to confirm the study place electronically.

If you cannot confirm the study place electronically, confirm the study place by using the form on the next page. See section "notification of confirmation of a study place". Make sure the form arrives to the address stated on the bottom of the page by 9th December 2019 at 3 pm (EET). If the form arrives to the higher education institution late, you will lose the study place.

When you confirm the study place, you will not be considered a first-time applicant in future applications. More information: Studyinfo.fi > Higher education > Applying > Quota for first-time applicants. After you have confirmed the study place, you must also register as an attending or a non-attending student for the spring term 2020 by the date given by the higher education institution or you will lose your right to study.

Registering as a student

You can register as a student in the higher education institution either electronically through the national registration service when you confirm the study place or in another way indicated by the higher education institution.

If you confirm the study place but remain on the waiting list for a study place higher on your preference list, you can only register as an attending or a non-attending student after your study place has been confirmed by the higher education institution. More detailed instructions on how to register can be found from the registration service and the higher education institution you have applied to (see the link on chapter "Instructions for new students").

NB! If you are required to pay tuition fees, you cannot register for the academic year before you have completed your payment. You can check this from the higher education institution.

You can register as non-attending for the first academic year only for statutory reasons, that is military or civilian service, maternity leave, paternity leave or parental leave or due to illness or disability. Not completing the registration will lead to forfeiting the right to study (Universities Act § 43 / Polytechnics Act § 32).

contents.name: sivu_2
contents.content:
$letterDate
$addressLabel.firstName $addressLabel.lastName

contents.name: email_body
contents.content:
Dear applicant

You have applied for a study place in the autumn 2019 joint application to higher education. You can download and print your admission result letter through the following link $securelink/tuloskirje.html. The link is valid for 3 months. Note that the letter shows your admission results according to the situation on 28th November 2019. Any changes in the admission situation (for example changes in your waiting list status) will not be updated to the result letter.

If you have been placed on the waiting list, the situation of the admission results can change daily. If you have a Finnish personal identity code and Finnish online banking credentials, a mobile certificate or a smart ID card and a reader, you can see your up-to-date situation in the My Studyinfo's Applications and accepting the offer of admission -service.

If you have been granted a study place and you do not have a Finnish personal identity code, you can confirm the study place through the link that has been sent to your email. Applicants with a Finnish personal identity code can confirm a study place in the My Studyinfo -service.

Important dates:

- You need to accept the study place by 9th December 2019 at 3 pm (EET)

- You can be accepted as a student from the waiting list until 17th December 2019 at 3 pm (EET) (depending on the study programme). If you are accepted from the waiting list after this email, you will receive a separate notification informing you about it.

You can accept only one higher education study place starting in the same academic term (1th January 2020 to 31th July 2020). The one study place per term provision applies to both higher education joint application and separate applications (transfer student applications are not included in the provision).

NB! This message has been sent automatically from the Studyinfo.fi service. Please do not reply to this email!
